current_state: High key-person dependency on the Security Lead for implementing compliance features (e.g., Log Integrity, Sandboxing).
recommended_action: Mandate pair programming sessions between the Security Lead and the Lead Backend Engineer for all security-critical tasks.
expected_benefit: Reduces bottleneck risk by 40% and improves the overall security competency of the backend team.
success_metrics: Lead Backend Engineer can independently review and implement medium-complexity security features.
roi_calculation: Avoids potential project delays worth an estimated $30,000 if the Security Lead becomes unavailable.

current_state: Single QA Engineer has high utilization (85%), posing a risk to sprint velocity and quality, especially for performance testing (RISK-004).
recommended_action: Invest in developer-led quality initiatives: enforce a strict 'Definition of Done' that requires developers to write their own integration tests for new API endpoints and E2E tests for simple UI workflows.
expected_benefit: Shifts 20% of the testing load from the QA Engineer to the development team, reducing the QA bottleneck and improving code quality earlier in the cycle.
success_metrics: QA Engineer's utilization drops to a sustainable ~70%, and bug detection rate in the development phase increases by 15%.
roi_calculation: Reduces cost of fixing bugs late in the cycle by an estimated $15,000 over the project lifetime.
